weather_report:
As darkness envelops Downtown San Francisco, raindrops murmur against window panes, setting an intimate tone for the evening. The temperature has dropped, skimming just above fifty degrees, while a brisk south wind stirs the air at a spirited pace. The forecast weaves a tale of relentless rain throughout the night, promising to drench the city with up to an inch of new rainfall, turning streets into glistening reflections beneath muted city lights.

Tomorrow promises a continuation of this wet embrace, with rain scheduled to taper off but not without a steely chill lingering in the air. The clouds will hang low, masking the city’s skyline, creating a moody atmosphere that encourages slow, contemplative movements throughout the day. While outdoor activities might seem uninviting, a cozy café visit with a good book or a leisurely stroll through the misty streets might add solace to an otherwise drizzly day. Wrap yourself in layers to ward off the penetrating cold, perhaps a favorite wool sweater over a lighter jacket, and don’t forget an umbrella—an essential accessory for navigating the enveloping fog and sporadic downpours that define this weather narrative.
